comments:
Eclipse: 2.1 M4

I assume that there occured an error when activating my editor. Now there is 
the editor tab left opend and I can't close it because of this error. 

I debugged through the code and "pane" is null. It goes into the for loop but 
there is no IViewerReference which has a part that is identical to the "part". 
So the loop is exited without returning something and the execution comes 
to "return pane.getPartReference();" but "pane" is null.

	if(pane == null) { 
		/* An error has occurred while creating the view.
		   Reference is needed during clean up. */
		IViewReference refs[] = getViewReferences();
		for (int i = 0; i < refs.length; i++) {
			if(refs[i].getPart(false) == part)
				return refs[i];
		}
	}
	return pane.getPartReference();
